section.title: Overview
section.para: The Yum Extension is a simple wrapper around the yum command. It provides the yum change to efficiently install and uninstall RPM packages from Yum repositories with Config5.

section.title: Examples
section.para: Packages can be installed and uninstalled as shown in the following example spec file:
section.screen: RedHatEnterpriseServer: yum install gcc yum uninstall sane

section.title: Installation
section.para: This extension is contained in the archive extensions/yum.tgz which is part of the Config5 distribution. Simply extract this archive in the deploy directory.

section.title: Settings
section.para: This extension does not have any configurable settings.

section.title: Changes
section.para: This extension provides the yum change which has two actions: install and uninstall.

section.title: yum install
section.para: The install action of the yum change will install a single RPM package.
The parameter package is the package name without version numbers. The optional parameter repo specifies a repository that will be enabled for the installation.

example.title: Install
example.programlisting: sample: yum install gcc yum install mplayer rpmforge

section.title: yum uninstall
section.para: The uninstall action of the yum change will uninstall the specified package.
The parameter package is the package to uninstall.

section.title: Phase
section.para: The yum changes are applied in the packages phase.

section.title: Order and Application
section.para: All yum changes of a pass are applied in the order the changes are encountered during the parsing of the spec files.
The extension caches package information when checking for packages that have to be installed or uninstalled. Mixing yum and execute changes to install or uninstall packages is not supported.

section.title: Trigger Flag
section.para: The the trigger flag for triggered changes is set when package is installed or uninstalled.

section.title: Configuration Data Errors
section.para: Configuration data errors are fatal, no changes will be done to the system.

listitem.para: The action must be install or uninstall.

section.title: Configuration Application Errors
section.para: The following errors are reported for changes as they are applied but do not interrupt the application of other changes.

listitem.para: The named package could not be installed or uninstalled. Typically the package does not exist or there was an error with the yum command.
